click here to enter a sale

i wonder if you could just extend the gfd syntax to include a task attribute for forms
and if they can't see the gfd they can't do it unless they can hack geas
then have your app parse forms in the forms dir at sstartup
then it just presents a list of tasks defined
if a form doesn't have a task listed then it doesn't appear
so it might be better for the process list to control
have a task.conf in the /usr/local/gnue/etc dir
that could be the location of the table

then we can hook into it with anything we need later

you can create user interfaces that forms will display for data entry
you can see screenshots of all of this if you like
then click the screenshots section on the left hand side
there you can choose from forms or designer shots
as for geas the major issue we still face for serious production use
but it's easy for a person to bypass
is a supply-chain/accounting system that is under development in cvs
is write custom print apps and tie to buttons on forms
how do you split business logic and presentation
it allows the user to define business objects with methods
and you can access it like  a database in forms
and I'm not a geas expert
if neil or reinhard were arround they'd be much more helpfull
in the frontend you only define wich functions are called
you can add triggers to entry fields
in this mode geas is a database and nothgin more
however geas does have it's own triggers/methods for business objects
the way most bad apps are written is 2-tier i think.
after 0.1.0 of forms is out (2-3 weeks)
we're bringing forms N-tier on line
that'll tie form and geas together tightly so that forms can query geas methods and call them if needed
right now my understanding is that geas triggers work fine
so you can alter a field in 2-tier forms and ""save"" the changes
upon saving geas w/ fire it's triggers to manipulate the data
you know how to use cvs?
basically geas reads these files when it starts up
creates the needed db structures to provide object persistance automatically
but csvweb isn't working i think
shouldn't i be able to browse the tree
would be a good place to look too
you going to be arround for a bit?
i looked at the poll data and it said that accounting was 2:1 wanted over all others
i did not see wxmac in that list
so i am banging out accounting stuff
that page is the collection of docs for class designs for GEAS
would it possible to use these files right now with geas?
we have not had time to integrate that stuff into the core web site
but we are a bit behind in implemented forms and reports
and geas methods are not very good right now
and we need some improvements in the geas driver in forms
i understand that theimproved geas driver is next up after this release
i mean that we have gcd files
the interface between forms and geas
and we're about to break almost all of them :)
ScreenSaver: what backend are you using?
geas only uses postgresql and mysql backends
ScreenSaver: but if you wanted to write an informix driver its not too complicated
and we would be real happy
what does geas do with these gcd files.
creates the defined objects and manages them
it creates SQL tables and manages the access from forms via CORBA ORG
perhaps i first should get a deeper knowledge in the gnue system.
ScreenSaver: none of the rest of us understood what we were doing when we wrote the code ;)
what will happen if there are already data in these tables
you have to do it manually
so it really only creates tables during the first start and on the next startup
it will add columns or tables that dont exists
e.g adding a property to a object
and report if the tables do no agree with the class definitions
and new property equates to a new column
how can it interact with geas?
it interacts with geas through CORBA ORB
so there is an IDL file that defines an API
and the front end can be any thing that works with CORBA
but have example of Java and C
that's sounds like if you are going to create a gnu-sap?
but functionality we cover the same business functions
is that we manage complexity better
i don't know sap very good.
so our system will scale better from small business
we also use objects for the n-tier (geas)
most small and middel size solutions are bad
yes a lot of solutions have tried to migrate from one size to another and its difficult
we are designing our system with that in mind
about 50% is made in a visual-basic way

you will be able to use it to generate output in various formats
and what is the status right now?
a few weeks till we see any kind of release

but does no conversion to other formats

and when it does it will use CORBA ORB just
so there is no way to print something?
but it's by no means an end user product
